thread.title: Muslim Superhero Ms. Marvel Gets a Stunning Portrait That Supports the ACLU
thread.title_full: Muslim Superhero Ms. Marvel Gets a Stunning Portrait That Supports the ACLU

author: sarah@dailydot.com (Sarah Weber)
title: Muslim Superhero Ms. Marvel Gets a Stunning Portrait That Supports the ACLU
text:
Screengrab via DavidMack/Twitter Ms. Marvel is being heroic in a whole new way. 
As Americans protested the Trump administration’s executive order on immigration last weekend, many of them turned to Muslim-American superhero Ms. Marvel as a symbol of hope and resistance. 
Many made their own Ms. Marvel protest signs, and some kids even dressed up like young hero Kamala Khan in her lightning-bolt-adorned super suit. Ms. Marvel didn't need no protest sign this time. Kamala Khan approves of the variant cover art @philnoto #NoBanNoWall pic.twitter.com/w3K9AiWA3m Now author and artist David Mack, best known in the comics community for his Jessica Jones and Alias covers, is offering fans a beautiful, officially licensed print of Ms. Marvel. This is being offered as an official licensed print from @GAppleComics . — David Mack (@davidmackkabuki) January 31, 2017 The print is available at Golden Apple Comics for $25, and a portion of proceeds go to the American Civil Liberties Union, the organization that led the legal charge against the executive order.
